Reviews.Title: “Negative”
Reviews.Author: Dhiradj
Reviews.Content: Good: Room was clean. Free internet Bad: Matrass felt like concrete. Receptionists not friendly (except one). Bad breakfast service eg not asking if you like coffee or tea. Shower was very small and water sometimes heats up suddenly, a very dangerous combination leading to burning of shoulders and back. Location: - out of the city, but not at a nice quiet location. They did not have a city map with the hotel on it?

Reviews.Title: “A good choice if you can live with the caveat (location)”
Reviews.Author: ip202659
Reviews.Content: Picking a hotel in Rome can be tough, particularly if you’re travelling in a peak season (vacation or a busy European bank holiday). Central hotels are easily too expensive. The alternative is to stay outside the centre but somewhere with good transport links. The Cilicia fits the latter category. On the one hand, the metro is too far out to be counted on, it’s a good 20 minute walk up the street, hardly worth the hassle. The bus network though is likely to be your best friend while staying at the Cilicia. Here are tips for the 3/4 buses you should keep in mind, departing from Piazza Zama which is a 5 minute walk up from the hotel: 360 brings you to the Colosseum area 673 brings you to Termini 628 to the Piazza Venezia / Argentina / Piazza Navona area (maybe even the Vatican if you are willing to endure the 15 minute walk from there) and ultimately goes to Giardino which is a 5 minute walk from the Ponte della Musica which you should cross to visit the MAXXI Modern Art Museum and the Auditorium (Music). However be careful regarding the "return leg" as during my stay (late Oct.'11) 628 could not be relied on to come back (it was so infrequent bordering on non-existent!); a good alternative if you're in the city centre is bus 87 which is frequent and comes through Argentina to Piazza Venezia and brings you to Piazza Tuscolo, an easy 10 minutes walk up the road from the hotel (hence a descent when coming back from downtown in the evening or night). In the morning you should count on 45-50 mins door to door from hotel to city centre if you're going by bus. Do keep in mind that traffic in Rome is hectic, what looks like a relatively short distance can take some time to cover. Also, during rush hours buses can be absolutely packed! As for nearby restaurants, right next to Piazza Tuscolo is a nice place called Mangiafuoco with decent prices (15 to 20 Eur per person) and good food. But there are few decent places to eat close to hotel, you're better off dining in the city centre (Campo dei Fiori and surroundings, for instance). For any die hard AS Roma fans out there though the most fanatical of Roma café/restaurants sits 100 metres from the hotel, Co re Di Roma it’s called (when exiting the hotel to the right, take the first left then the first right). As for location positives: it’s rather close to an entrance to the Via Appia Antica and apparently the info. point is rather close by (unfortunately I missed the opportunity to see it). It’s simple enough: exit to the left of the hotel and walk Via Cilicia for some 200 metres, an exit to the right descending from Via Cilicia onto the Via Appia Antica. Rooms are comfortable and large enough (sorry that I didn’t take any pictures, but the hotel pictures can be relied upon). Breakfast is simple as it tend to be in Rome hotels of this standard, but it's just enough. For the price I paid (just under 70 Eur per night per room incl. breakfast for 2) I have no complaints really. I got what I expected and I consider it very good value. If you plan on leaving the hotel in the morning and to come back late in the evening or night, you know what to expect and you will be fine. If it’s your first time in Rome you may be a little frustrated at the location and prefer somewhere more central - your pick. If you’ve been to Rome though and willing to endure a bit of walking (as you should in Rome, it's a walker's city by excellence) and public transportation it’s absolutely fine and you will relish the money that you saved on the lodging.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely valentine's stay”
Reviews.Author: dimithri1974
Reviews.Content: Lovely Hotel with a beautiful big room....Beautifully decorated ,old style...minor breakages which can be easily sorted....but very roomy with a nice big wardrobe, mini fridge, side tables and lamps, and desk with large mirrors. Big bathroom although the shower cubicle was small...Has a little issue with the drainage as water drained out of it slowly...easily fixed..Enjoyed the breakfasts there in a very nicely decorated dining area...good coffe was served...the entrance to the hotel was lovely and so was the garden around...lots of parking..GIANLUCA was the best..very friendly , the others didn't speak much english but were pleasant....TRANSPORT ..WAS THE BIGGEST ISSUE...very far from metro stations, there were buses but difficult to find where the stops were,long walk

Reviews.Title: “dont go there, terrible service!!!”
Reviews.Author: vz49193
Reviews.Content: me and my wife stayed there 4 nights 2 weeks ago. the hotel is clean and nice, big and comfortable rooms, and even the viwe is nice. but!!! hotel receptionist's are the worst!! and not just one of theme but the whole crue is very very bad!! they didnt know where are the bus stations, they make a face everytime you ask theme something until the piont you stop asking, and if they already give you an answer it usualy not correct. for a hotel that is not in a good location, its not worth the staying.

Reviews.Title: “Fine and affordable hotel - not so far out if you don't mind walking”
Reviews.Author: TomElkins
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine for the money - room was a little small, and the breakfast pretty "average"...but again for the money these seemed more than adequate. It is however 20mins walk to the metro - the reception says 10, but we're avid hikers and it takes 20. From door to Spagna station is 45mins or so. We walked to the Coliseum one day and it takes 40 mins - not so bad for a major city stay. Coach parties etc do prevail... We went to the local trattoria and had one of the best meals of our stay - dodgy walk to get there, but seriously worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Curlytopt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great...it's more like a 4 star than a 3. The decor is tasteful and the rooms are exceptionally clean. The service was great too. I really looked forward to the breakfast each morning, the food selection was great and also very fresh. The only complaint I would have is that it's a bit far from the city centre. Definitely not walking distance although there is a metro station close by. I would suggest studying the metro system in advance if you are staying here, it will save you a lot of time and money. Oh and although most rooms have balconies, there is one room in the hotel on the corner that has a huge rooftop terrace that is only accessible to those people staying in that room...The view is amazing!!!!! It has two double beds and one is in a closed off room...Our group was upgraded to this room at no charge (I think because they were at capacity) and it was a great perk to the stay... Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel- but really far away”
Reviews.Author: sound_fury
Reviews.Content: there are actually no complaints about the hotel itself- it is nice, clean, the rooms are in excellent condition, the bathrooms are good also and the staff is nice. but location is a major problem- especially for those who like to be out all night - becuse you will totaly depend on transport. if you go to rome in order to have fun in the center- froget about this place. if you go with your car, or hire a car there and want only sightseeing- so the hotel is a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Exsquusite”
Reviews.Author: JPMAkron
Reviews.Content: i loved everything and everybody. i cant say enought to compare to the service they gave me. there is a sign outsde that has there stars. but let me tell you from bangkok to hanoi to new york there is no better, most of which is because of patrizio and sandro If you go there ask to meet them, you'll be pleasantly surpprised. Kathy J Zurzolo-myers

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel. Reccommended”
Reviews.Author: anatz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Cilicia Hotel, for 5 days. Even though the room was on the first floor, facing the road, we had no noise. The room was renovated and very very good. We were surprised because we had selected the hotel for the low rate. Enough space for 2 people, very warm colours, large desk, very good mini bar (sensible prices) and a very big bathroom. We loved it. I agree that transportation can be a small problem on the first day. The metro station is 20 minutes walking, but it is a pleasant walk, we didn't mind. The only thing was that the line closed early due to constuctions in the station, so coming back was a bid of a problem. There is at least one bus that leaves from Termini station (last one at 00.30) and stops almost in front of the hotel. Taxis on Saturday night is a problem... and due to the traffic it can cost a lot. The only thing we didn't like much were the receptionists attitude. Not very polite nor helpful. They made us feel as we were bothering them with our questions, and their english, well some of them could use some extra lessons. Anyway we left with the best impressions

Reviews.Title: “"Ok once youv'e worked out transport system"”
Reviews.Author: BonnyScot
Reviews.Content: Hotel was light and airy and kept very clean was lovely to come back to air con and shower after hot day walking round sights. Staff friendly and helpful no problems. Brekkie fine We took on board prev comments re long walk to metro station Bus is deffo best bet 360 or 228 from via Satrico takes you to San Giovanni metro We also got buses back to the hotel from all areas and attractions in the city no problems either to piazza Zama or via Latina which is just a short walk from hotel There also a lovely walk to San Sebastian Catacoms from hotel passing Quo Vadis a welcome break from the bustle of the city. Family from Scotland 2 adults 2 teenage kids

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel however far from Centre & attractions”
Reviews.Author: Pepetito
Reviews.Content: Quite nice hotel, very comfortable, clean, renovated and even with a hint of luxury, located inside a small park with lots of greenery & blossom. Decent brekker, attentive service, pleasantly furnished rooms with all these plush interiors, I even thought of 4* stars level staying there. However there's one considerable disadvantage - situated far from Rome centre, so no way to reach attractions by feet and to get nearest metro station takes ~25min if walked very quickly. Means - always check the city maps before agreeing with your travel agency's choice of hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The reception could have been a little more helpful when we were asking information. And there is an easier way to reach the hotel than the metro. (And that is to use a bus from termini station.) The breakfast was poor. The room was very good and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Decent mid-price hotel”
Reviews.Author: Frenkyboy76
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 days in the end of July. This is a mid class hotel with about 40 rooms. The double room we stayed in was small but well equipped and furnished, with controllable AC, cable and a bathroom/shower. Rooms and hotel were very clean, staff speaks reasonable English and was generally helpful. Complimentary breakfast was more than decent, including fresh rolls, coffee, cereal, fruit and bread. Main disadvantage is the hotel location: although near Rome's center the nearest subway station is about 1.5 kilometers away. There is a bus stop (bus 360) about 100 mtrs down the street, with about 2 busses/hr from Termini (4 kilometers from hotel). If you need to return to the hotel frequently during daytrips I would not recommend this hotel. If you plan to use it for sleeping and breakfast only it's more than fine. Pro: good value at about 60-70 euro/night for a double, clean and well equipped. Con: trips to Rome only possible by public transport unless you really like walking. Alternatives might be hotels in the outer suburbs that are closer to a subway station if you can find one.

HotelInfo.Name: Cilicia Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Via Cilicia 7, 00179 Rome, Italy
